Key Match Events: Connor Wong hit a home run off Casey Mize in the sixth inning to put the Boston Red Sox ahead 4-0.
The Detroit Tigers lost to the Boston Red Sox 7-5 in extra innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Casey Mize reflected on his performance, noting the need to improve his pitch placement, especially in critical counts.
Manager A.J. Hinch commented on Mize's mixed performance, acknowledging both good and misfired pitches.
Catcher Jake Rogers mentioned that Mize wanted to be perfect and that his performance, while not his best, was still acceptable.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Casey Mize's fastball velocity was down, averaging 93.8 mph compared to his season average of 95.6 mph.
Mize generated nine swings-and-misses over his 85-pitch outing, including four with his fastball and two with his slider.
Boston batters launched eight balls off Mize's pitches at 100 mph or faster, with an average exit velocity of 92 mph.
